title: Prysm hanging at New gRPC client connected to beacon node.
body:
Prysm failing hanging at New gRPC client connected to beacon node.

Is this normal, or how long should it take on a new instance of prysm?  I waited an hour then stopped it and tried again.
It maybe a time thing but I just dont know.  Normally I would just leave it over night, but I keep getting penalized as I haven't been able to get this node working correctly, so any help would be greatly appreciated.

Also will a ssd over usb3 be fast enough?

time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain" endpoint="/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc" prefix=powchain
time="2020-12-23 09:08:10" level=info msg="New gRPC client connected to beacon node" addr="127.0.0.1:47416" prefix=rpc

Using centos 8 with prysim v1.0.5
Using ssd on a external usb3.

Started geth with
nohup /mnt/ssd/geth-linux-amd64-1.9.24-cc05b050/geth --syncmode light --cache 14 --rpc --rpcapi web3,eth,personal,miner,net,txpool --rpcport 8545 --rpcaddr 127.0.0.1 --ipcpath /root/.ethereum/geth.ipc > geth.log &

and prysm with
nohup /mnt/ssd/prysm/prysm.sh beacon-chain --accept-terms-of-use --http-web3provider=/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc --log-file=/var/log/prysm/prysmBeaconChain.log  &

[root@enode ~]# tail -f /var/log/prysm/prysmBeaconChain.log
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="Checking DB" database-path="/mnt/ssd/.eth2/beaconchaindata" prefix=node
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="Deposit contract: 0x" prefix=node
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="Waiting for state to be initialized" prefix=initial-sync
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="Starting beacon node" prefix=node version="Prysm/v1.0.5/6ec471deb. Built at: 2020-12-14 17:23:54+00:00"
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="Waiting to reach the validator deposit threshold to start the beacon chain..." prefix=blockchain
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="Starting JSON-HTTP API" address="127.0.0.1:3500" prefix=gateway
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="gRPC server listening on port" address="127.0.0.1:4000" prefix=rpc
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=warning msg="You are using an insecure gRPC server. If you are running your beacon node and validator on the same machines, you can ignore this message. If you want to know how to enable secure connections, see: https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/secure-grpc" prefix=rpc
time="2020-12-23 09:07:26" level=info msg="Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain" endpoint="/root/.ethereum/geth.ipc" prefix=powchain
time="2020-12-23 09:08:10" level=info msg="New gRPC client connected to beacon node" addr="127.0.0.1:47416" prefix=rpc
it was a time thing. after a few hors it has moved.
